results.title: Rice Growing in the Riverina = Irrigation farming in the Riverina
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Norman Castle and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Year round activity on the rice farms of the Riverina where rice is grown under irrigation in rotation with wheat, oats and fodder and sheep and cattle are also run. Sheep are sheared in August and during this time of the year the land is cultivated for the summer rice crop. Harvesting of the rice is done by contract when the rice ripens after five months and the rice is then processed at the co-operatively owned mill.

results.title: Return to the sea: a saga of survival
results.creator_credit: Ian McFadyen, Martin McGrath and Comedia
results.brief_description: A humorous parody of David Attenborough’s “Life on earth” documentaries. Our suburban mode of existence with its annual return to the beach resorts is likened to the ritualistic behaviour of members of the animal kingdom. Raises issues about the way we define the behaviour of cultures different from our own. Contains an early performance by Steve Vizard.
results.title_for_label: Return to the sea: a saga of survival

results.title: Return to Evercreech Junction. All change at Evercreech Junction. The friendly line to Burnham.
results.brief_description: For most passengers, a trip on the Somerset and Dorset, (affectionately known as the ‘Slow and Dirty’), meant seaside holidyas. It ran from Bath, up over Mendip Hills, before dropping down to Evercreech, the junction for Burnham-On-Sea, and onto Bournemouth. Before its unexpected closure in 1966, the Somerset and Dorset was filmed in colour by railway enthusiast, Ivo Peters of Bath. This is a vivid record of the steam age and the railwaymen who worked on the line

results.title: Rhino christmas
results.creator_credit: John Armstrong, Fiona Cochrane, Armstrong and Cochrane Productions
results.brief_description: It’s a hot and boringly predictable Christmas Day in the suburbs and Mott wishes it would snow. She’s sick of presents that are educational and of going to the beach with her new-age parents who meditate all day. But then weird things happen in this off beat fantasy.

results.title: Return from Witch Mountain
results.creator_credit: John Hough, Jerome Courtland, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Escape to Witch Mountain” this family film is full of adventure and fantasy as Tia (Kim Richards) and her brother Tony (Ike Eisenmann), both who have supernatural powers, arrive on Planet Earth for a holiday. Dr Gannon (Christopher Lee) and his offsider Letha (Bette Davis) are trying to develop a mind-control device and when the evil Dr Gannon learns of Tony’s special powers, he kidnaps him, leaving it to Tia with her telepathic powers, and a motley gang of youngsters, to rescue Tony.

results.title: Rhine boatmen
results.brief_description: An account of the lives of the 40,000 men and women who live on the boats that trade up and down the Rhine, with some description of the river and its history.

results.title: Rethinking rape (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This is an in depth look at rape, particularly rape perpetrated by people known to the victim. In order to understand the high frequency of rape and its social causes, we must examine our cultural attitudes towards women, male/female relationships and rape itself. Six people of varying backgrounds, including a Rape Crisis Centre director, and a social psychologist, share their perspective’s on this topic.

results.title: Rewind, tape 2 eps. 14-26
results.creator_credit: Margaret Murphy, Film Australia, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: A series of entertaining 5-minute history bytes narrated by Jack Thompson. Using newsreels, documentaries, home movies, television and cinema advertisements, each segment presents a snapshot of the evolution of everyday Australian life, attitudes and habits through the twentieth century. The segments are grouped around the six themes of “Rituals”, “Leisure”, ‘Rights and responsibilities”, “Environment”, “Building a society” and “Changing ways”. Tape Two contains episodes 14-26. They are entitled: “Fighting nature”, “Law of this land”, “Horse power”, “Your attention is requested”, “Sea around us”, “Dress sense”, “Great prospects”, “Making Australia home”, “Frozen images”, “A Fair Go”, “To be or not to be”, “Suburban dreams” and “A call to arms”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Murphy, Film Australia, National Film and Sound Archive of Australia and SBS Independent

The segments are grouped around the six themes of “Rituals”, “Leisure”, ‘Rights and responsibilities”, “Environment”, “Building a society” and “Changing ways”. Tape One contains episodes 1-13. They are: “School days”, “Made in Australia”, “Getting Around” “Reel Appeal”, “Country life”, “Breaking away”,”Christmas in Australia”, “Skiing”, “Dealing with disaster”, “Money business”, “Nice day for a wedding”, “Holidays” and “Eating habits”.
